newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: TENNIS-WAYNE FERREIRA TO TEAM UP WITH BUDDING STAR.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-WAYNE FERREIRA TO TEAM UP WITH BUDDING STAR.

text.p: World number eight Wayne Ferreira will team up with emerging South African star Jeff Coetzee as a doubles pairing in some international tournaments scheduled for later this year, Ferreira said on Thursday.

Speaking on the eve of his country's world group, first- round Davis Cup tie against Russia at Durban's Westridge Park Stadium, South Africa's number one player said this was his way of helping to perpetuate South Africa's tennis legacy.
"I am proud to be a South African and...I feel it's important to put something back into the game.
"By teaming up with an up-and-coming young South African tennis player, I can hopefully contribute to the development of tennis in this country," he said.

The 19-year-old Coetzee, from Okip in the Northern Cape, has only been playing on the satellite and challenge tour for nine months and has already climbed to a world ranking of 597 as a singles player and 370 in the doubles.

"I managed to get to Wimbledon and played guys like Yannick Noah at an early age," Ferreira said. "While it's very important for someone of Jeff Coetzee's age to play on the satellite tour, I think it is even more important to play at least once or twice against the very best in the world.
"Only then can you realise straight away your potential and where you are as a tennis player against them."
Ferreira said he and Coetzee would be trying to get into as many tournaments as possible as a wild card entry during the northern hemisphere's summer months.

"Jeff has now got to work on his ranking and, ideally, get it down to 200 in his singles in his first year," Ferreira said. "Together, we'll be looking to get his doubles ranking down to 100 -- that would be good."
